result.trip_overview_narrative: Lycee Francais de San Francisco offers a Global Learning program that provides educational travel experiences from Primary school through High School. These trips align with curricular themes such as History & Geography, Science & Technology, Languages & Culture, Sports, and Service Learning. Trips include day and overnight experiences designed to foster student engagement, confidence, and language skills through immersion and hands-on activities.

programs.duration: varied by trip, examples include four-day trips and week-long trips

evidence.quote: Global Learning is a program of educational travels that from Primary school to Lycée High, allows students to enjoy the incredible power of bilingual education outside the classroom as teachers translate classroom learning into a rich variety of travel experiences.
In Grade 3, our students head out for a four-day experience designed to deepen their understanding of the world around them.

Destination : Coloma, Gold Country - An enriching overnight field trip to Coloma allows our students to explore the historic Gold Rush and deepen their connection to this pivotal chapter in California’s history.
Destination : Germany - Our German-language students stay with host families to discover the southwest region of Germany through full cultural immersion.
Destination : New Orleans, Louisiana - The trip to New Orleans offers our Gr 7 students a rich and immersive introduction to the history and culture of Louisiana.
Destination : Happy Valley , Santa Cruz (CA) - All Grade 2 students travel to Santa Cruz for a few days immersed in nature at the Happy Valley Center.
Selected weeks include field trips or lunch from our new Cantine!

unknowns: Exact frequency of trips per grade beyond examples
